question:
‘A + B' means 'A is the sister of B’.

'A - B' means 'A is the brother of B’.

'A × B' means 'A is the father of B'.

‘A ÷ B' means 'A is the wife of B'.

IF A + B - C ÷ D × E - F, then which of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_3: A is the sister of the wife of D.
solution:
(b)

E is the brother of B. It is not correct.

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers ofthe following set.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into their constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)

(85, 24, 133)

(97, 36, 145)
solution:
(a)

Logic:- (First number - Second number) = 61 , (Third number - Second number) = 109

(85, 24, 133):- (85 - 24) = 61 , (133 - 24) = 109

(97, 36, 145):- (97 - 36) = 61 , (145 - 36) = 109

Similarly,

(79, 18, 127):- (79 - 18) = 61 , (127 - 18) = 109

question: In a certain code language, if 'PDU' is written as '40' and 'HXO' is written as '34', how will 'BMW' be written in the same code language?
solution:
(c)

Logic:- Sum of the place value of opposite letters

(PDU):- KWF → (11 + 23 + 6) = 40

(HXO):- SCL → (19 + 3 + 12) = 34

Similarly,

(BMW):- YND → (25 + 14 + 4) = 43

question:
Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?

625 ÷ 25 + 7 × 318 - 112 = 381
solution:
(d)

Given:- 625 ÷ 25 + 7 × 318 - 112 = 381

After going through all the options, option d satisfies the equation

625 ÷ 25 × 7 + 318 - 112 = 381

25 × 7 + 318 - 112 = 381

175 + 318 - 112 = 381

493 - 112 = 381

381 = 381

LHS = RHS

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following set.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is NOT allowed)

(2, 114, 19)

(12, 216, 6)
solution:
(b)

Logic:- Second number ÷ ( First number × Third number) = 3

(2, 114, 19):- 114 ÷ (2 ×19) = 3 , 114 ÷ 38 = 3

(12, 216, 6):- 216 ÷ (12 × 6) = 3 , 216 ÷ 72 = 3

Similarly,

(6, 144, 8):- 144 ÷ (6 × 8) = 3 , 144 ÷ 48 = 3

question:
If '+' means 'division', '-' means 'multiplication', ' ÷ ' means 'addition' and '×' means 'subtraction', then what is the value of the following expression?

14 - 4 ÷ 133 + 7 × 17
solution:
(a)

Given:- 14 - 4 ÷ 133 + 7 × 17

After replacing the mathematical sign with mathematical sign we get

14 × 4 + 133 ÷ 7 - 17

= 56 + 19 - 17

= 75 - 17

= 58

question:
Study the given pattern carefully and select the number that can replace the question mark (?) in it.

(6, 2, 34)

(1, 5, 13)

(9, 1, ?)

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc, to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)
solution:
(a)

Logic:- (First number × Second number) × 3 - 2 = Third number

(6, 2, 34):- (6 × 2) × 3 - 2 = 34

(1, 5, 13):- (1 × 5) × 3 - 2 = 13

Similarly,

(9, 1, ?):- (9 ×1) × 3 - 2 = 25

question: President of India, Droupadi Murmu presented the _________ of the Digital India Awards on 7th January 2023 in New Delhi.
solution: (c) 7th edition. Digital India Awards (2009): Institutionalized under the ambit of National Portal of India to honor exemplary initiatives/practices in Digital-Governance. It was initially known as Web Ratna Awards until 2014 and re-named Digital India Awards from 2016. Droupadi Murmu (15th President) - The first tribal President and second female President after Pratibha Patil (12th President) of India.

question: In January 2022, who was named for the Rachael Heyhoe Flint Trophy for ICC Women's Cricketer of the Year?
solution: (d)Smriti Mandhana: An Indian cricketer represents the women's national team. Nat Sciver (England’s all-rounder) - Won the Rachael Heyhoe Flint Trophy for the ICC Women's Cricketer of the Year (2022). Rachael Heyhoe Flint Trophy - Named after the former England women's cricket captain, Rachael Heyhoe Flint. First edition - 2020.

question: The chemical formula of propene is :
solution: (c)C3H6. Propene, also known as propylene, is a hydrocarbon compound belonging to the group of alkenes. Alkenes are unsaturated hydrocarbons that have at least one carbon-carbon double bond (C=C) in their chemical structure. General formula (CnH2n). Propyne - C3H4. Ethylene - C2H4. Acetylene - C2H2. Alkanes - General formula (CnH2n+2). Alkynes - General formula (CnH2n-2).

question: Which of the following is the closest wild relative of domestic cattle protected in some of the famous national parks of India like Nagarhole and Bandipur?
solution: (d) Gaur.First population estimation exercise of the Indian Gaur (Bison) was carried out in the Nilgiris Forest Division (Tamil Nadu). National parks: Corbett National Park (1936) - Uttarakhand. Kanha National Park (1955) - Madhya Pradesh. Tadoba National Park (1955) - Maharashtra. Gir National Park (1965) - Gujarat. Bandipur National Park (1974) - Karnataka. Ranthambore National Park (1980) - Rajasthan. Simlipal National Park (1980) - Odisha.

question: An annual statement of the estimated receipts and expenditure of the government over the fiscal year is known as _________.
solution: (d)Budget: Article 112 - Annual financial statement.Financial year of India - 1 April to 31 March. First Union Budget of Colonial India was presented in the year 1860 by James Wilson, who was a Scottish economist and politician. First Union Budget of independent India was presented by R. K. Shanmukham Chetty on 26th November 1947. Union Budget (2021-22) - First paperless budget presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Uttar Pradesh - First Indian state to present a paperless budget (2021).

question: What is the name of the scheme launched to fund infrastructure and social development projects in the Northeast for a period of four years from 2022 - 23 to 2025 - 26?
solution: (d)PM - DevINE (Prime Minister’s Development Initiative for North East Region): A Central Sector Scheme with 100% Central funding. It will be implemented by the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (MDONER). Other Schemes: Pradhan Mantri North East Rural Livelihood Project (2012), Pradhan Mantri Innovative Learning Programme ‘DHRUV’ (2019), Pradhan Mantri Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (2020).

question: 32. Who was hailed as a resident dancer of Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam for her unique contribution to the promotion of classical dance forms?
solution: (c) Yamini Krishnamurthy. She is an Indian dancer of Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi, recognised as “Asthana Nartaki” of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam Awards - Padma Shri (1968), Padma Bhushan (2001) and Padma Vibhushan (2016). Uma Sharma (Kathak): Awards - Padma Shri (1973), Padma Bhushan (2001). Rukmini Devi (Bharatanatyam): Awards - Padma Bhushan (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957). Ragini Devi ( Kathakali).

question: In February 2021, through which of the following cases did the Supreme court rule that in the cases when the Juvenile offender is under 18 years and above 16 years, he/she should be remitted to jurisdictional Juvenile Justice Board?
option_1: Rahul Sharma v. National Insurance Company Ltd
option_3: Laxmibai Chandaragi v. The State of Karnataka
solution: (d)Devilal v. State of Madhya Pradesh. Famous Cases in India: Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India (1978) - deals with the interpretation of Article 21 of the Indian Constitution. Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala (1973) - Known as ‘Fundamental Rights Case’ or "Basic Structure Doctrine" case. S. R. Bommai v. Union of India (1994) - case pertains to the dismissal of state governments using Article 356 (President's Rule) , M.C. Mehta v. Union of India (1986) - also known as Oleum gas leakage case, Naz Foundation v. Govt. of NCT of Delhi (2006) - first legal challenge against Section 377.

question: Which part of the Constitution of India contains the provisions of the Union Executive?
solution: (a)Part V:- The Union, Articles (52-151): Articles (52-62) - President. Articles (63-73) - Vice-president. Article 78 - Duties of the Prime Minister as respects the furnishing of information to the President, etc. Articles (74 -77) - Council of Ministers. Article 76 - Attorney-General for India. Article (112-117) - Procedure in Financial Matters. Part III - Fundamental Rights (Article 12 to 35), Part IV - Directive Principle of State Policy (Article - 36 to 51), Part VI - The States (Article 152 to 237).

question: Which of the following countries on the highest number of gold medals in the Tokyo Paralympic 2020?
solution: (c)China. Tokyo Paralympic 2020: Motto - United by Emotion. Nations participated - 162. China topped the table for a fifth successive Games with 207 medals. Nations that achieved their first-ever Paralympic gold medals include Ethiopia, Pakistan, Ecuador, Sri Lanka, Costa Rica, and the United Arab Emirates. Paralympic 2024 will be held in Paris (France). Paralympic Games are organized by the International Paralympic Committee (IPC), formed on 22nd September 1989, with headquarters in Bonn, Germany.

question: Which of the following countries has hosted the three Asian Games?
solution: (a)South Korea (1986, 2002 and 2014). Asian Games: Organised by the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) after every 4 years. Headquarters - Kuwait. New Delhi, India, hosted the first Asian Games in 1951 and the second time in 1982. 20th Asian Games (2026) will be held in Nagoya (Japan). Sprinter Kamaljeet Sandhu - First Indian woman to win an individual Asian Games gold medal (400 m race) at the Asian Games 1970 in Bangkok (Thailand). Thailand (Bangkok) - Hosted the most number of Asian Games (1966, 1970, 1978 and 1998).

question: Who led the English army in the Battle of Buxar?
solution: (c)Hector Munro. Battle of Buxar (1764): Fought between British East India Company and the combined armies of Mir Qasim (Nawab of Bengal). Important battles: Battle of Plassey (1757) - Fought between British East India Company (led by Robert Clive) and Siraj-Ud-Daulah (Nawab of Bengal). First Anglo-Mysore War (1767-1769) - Fought between the British East India Company against Hyder Ali of Mysore. Second Anglo-Mysore War (1780 -1784), Battle of Pollilur (1781), Third Anglo-Mysore War (1790 - 1792), Fourth Anglo-Mysore War (1798-1799), First Anglo-Maratha War (1775 -1782).

question: Which of the following amendments to the Indian Constitution made the Right to Property a Legal Right in place of a Fundamental Right?
solution: (c) 44th. Part XIIArticle 300A - Persons not to be deprived of property save by authority of law. Part III (Article 12-35): Fundamental rights are justiciable, meaning that individuals can approach the courts to seek remedies if they are violated. They include the right to equality, freedom, protection against exploitation, freedom of religion, cultural and educational rights, and the right to constitutional remedies.

question: Changai dance is associated with which Indian state?
solution: (c)Nagaland. Changai Dance: Performed by the Chang tribe during the Naknyulum festival, which lasts for three days. Folk Dances of Nagaland: Aaluyattu (Konyak tribe), Agurshikukula (war dance), Butterfly Dance (Zeliang tribe), Khamba Lim, Kuki Dance, Leshalaptu, Mayur Dance (Animal dance). Modse (Ao tribe), Monyu Asho, Sadal Kekai (Kuki tribe), Seecha & Kukui Kucho (Angami tribe), Rengma.

question: Which is the national fruit of Bangladesh?
solution: (d)Jackfruit. National fruits and Countries: India (Mango), Nepal (Raspberry), Saudi Arabia (Dates), Serbia (Plum), Singapore (Durian), Ukraine (cherry), Vietnam (Dragon fruit), Canada - (Blueberries), Afghanistan (Pomegranate), New Zealand (Kiwifruit), Pakistan (Mango - Summer and Guava - Winter).

question: Which of the following chemicals is used as a preservative to slow browning and discolouration in foods and beverages during preparation, storage and distribution?
solution: (c)Sulphites. Other Food preservatives: Benzoic acid, Sodium benzoate, nitrites, sodium sorbate and potassium sorbate. Nitrous oxide (N2O) - Laughing gas. Uses - Anaesthetic, Semiconductor manufacturing industry, Rocket motors as an oxidiser. Phosgene (COCl2) also called Carbonyl chloride. Uses - Dyestuffs, isocyanates, pesticides and pharmaceuticals. Chlorine (Cl2) is used in water treatment, bleaching and disinfectants.

question: Which of the following reforming societies believed Vedas to be the fountain of all the knowledge?
solution: (c) Arya Samaj. Founded by Swami Dayanand Saraswati in 1875 Bombay (now Mumbai), India. Societies and Founder: Madame H. P. Blavatsky and Colonel Olcott - Theosophical Society (1875) in New York (United States). Atmaram Panduranga - Prarthana Samaj (1867) in Maharashtra. Raja Ram Mohan Roy - Brahmo Samaj (1828) in Kolkata.

question: Which of the following pairs of musicians and their instruments is INCORRECT?
solution: (b)Pt. Ram Narayan - Sarod. He is a Sarangi Player. Instruments and Musicians: Sarangi - Shakoor Khan, Ramesh Mishra, Sultan Khan, Ustad Binda Khan. Sarod - Buddhadev Dasgupta, Allauddin Khan, Ali Akbar Khan, Amjad Ali Khan, Sharan Rani, Zarin S Sharma. Violin - VG Jog, MS Gopalakrishnan, NR Muralidharan, M Chandrasekharan. Shehnai - Krishna Ram Chaudhary, Ali Ahmad Hussain. Sitar - Shahid Parvez Khan, Budhaditya Mukherjee, Anushka Shankar, Hara Shankar Bhattacharya, Nikhil Banerjee.

question: The Second Five - Year Plan (1956 - 61) had a major goal of achieving which of the following targets?
option_3: Rapid industrialisation with focus on heavy industries
solution: (c)Rapid industrialisation with focus on heavy industries. Five Year Plan in India: Aim - To Promote economic growth, social welfare, poverty reduction, regional balance and self-reliance in a planned and systematic manner. First Five year Plan (1951-1956) Presented by first PM Jawahar lal Nehru. Growth with social justice and Equality- 9th five-year plan (1997-2002). Growth with stability - Fourth Five Year Plan (1969-1974). Self-reliant and self-generating economy - Third five-year plan (1961-1966).

question: Seismograph is used to measure :
solution: (c) earthquakes. Richter scale - It is used to measure the magnitude of earthquakes. Instruments and Uses: Udometer(Amount of liquid precipitation), Anemometer (wind speed), Barometer (Atmospheric pressure), Hygrometer (humidity), Lactometer (Purity of milk), Venturi meter (Flow rate of liquid in a pipe), Altimeter (Altitude), Manometer (Pressure in pipes).

question: This event is celebrated to mark the resurrection of Christ. Identify the event.
solution: (a)Easter. Important Christian days and festivals: Christmas day - Birth of Jesus Christ.Good Friday - Jesus was crucified. Holy Thursday or Maundy Thursday - refers to the Thursday before Easter in the Christian calendar. It commemorates the Last Supper of Jesus Christ with his apostles. Epiphany (Twelfth Night) - Christian feast day celebrated on January 6th, twelve days after Christmas, commemorating the visit of the Magi (Wise Men or Three Kings) to the infant Jesus in Bethlehem.

question: Which of the following is another name for starch found mainly in the pulp of seeds, fruits, tubers, roots and stems of plants, especially in corn, potatoes, wheat and rice?
solution: (a)Amylum:- A polymeric carbohydrate consisting of numerous glucose units joined by glycosidic bonds. Olestra (Olean) - Fat substitute that doesn't add any calories to products. Saponins - They are naturally occurring compounds that are widely distributed in all cells of legume plants. Xanthan (polysaccharide) produced from simple sugars using a fermentation process. Uses - common food additive, thickening agent, emulsifier, and stabilizer that prevents ingredients from separating.

question: Which of the following systems of the Delhi sultanate had a influence on the Bahmani and Vijayanagar kingdoms?
solution: (d) Iqtadari System:- Introduced by Shamsuddin IIltutmish (3rd Sultan of Delhi). Provision - Under this system, the land of the empire was divided into several large and small tracts called Iqta and assigned these Iqtas to his soldiers, officers and nobles. Administrative Terms used in Sultanate Period: Dabir (Secretary), Faujdar (Commander of army), Sipahsalar (Commander), Amil (Revenue officer), Diwan (Office: the central secretariat).

question: 49. What is the product formed when CH3CH2OH reacts with O2?
option_2: CO2 + H2O + heat and light
solution: (b)CO2 + H2O + heat and light. Reaction: CH3CH2OH (ethanol) + 3O2 (Oxygen)→ 2CO2 (Carbon dioxide) + 3H2O (water) + Heat And Light. Redox Reaction (Oxidation-Reduction Reaction): Involves the transfer of electrons between reactants, leading to oxidation and reduction. Displacement Reaction: One element displaces another in a compound, with the more reactive element replacing the less reactive one. Double Displacement Reaction: Positive ions from two ionic compounds switch places, leading to the formation of two new compounds.

question: What was the function of an officer called Samaharta?
solution: (b)Tax assessment.Officers during the Mauryan administration: Shulkadhyaksha (Officer-in-charge of royal income), Koshadhyaksha (Treasury officer), Lakshanadhyaksha (Coin minting), Rajjukas (Land measurer), Yukta (Subordinate revenue officer), Sannidata (Treasury head), Panyadhyaksha (Office of commerce department).

question: The lengths of the three sides of a triangle are 30 cm, 42 cm and x cm. Which of the following is correct?
option_4: 12 ≤ x ≤ 72
solution:
(c)

Let the length of third side of triangle = x

The 3rd side of the triangle is always greater than the difference of the other two sides

and less than the sum of the other two sides.

Then , (42 - 30)＜x＜(42 + 30) = 12 < x < 72

question: The largest 5-digit number exactly divisible by 88 is:
solution:
(d)

Largest 5-digit number = 99999

According to question,

9999988 ⇒ Remainder = 31

Required number = 99999 - 31 = 99968

question:
The following pie chart shows the monthly sale of laptops of five companies A, B, C, D and E in a store.

If 2,500 laptops were sold by the store in a month, then what is the difference between the number of laptops sold of Company A and that of Company C?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694239628/word/media/image52.png
solution:
(c)

Here, (100) % = 2500

According to question,

Required Difference(40 - 8) % = 2500×(40-8)100 = 800

question: If a + 1a = 7, then a5 + 1a5 is equal to:
solution:
(a)

Given, a + 1a = 7

a2 + 1a2 = 7²- 2 = 47

a3 + 1a3 =7³ - (3 × 7) = 322

a5 + 1a5 = (a2 + 1a2)×(a3 + 1a3)-(a + 1a)

a5 + 1a5 = 47 × 322 - 7 = 15127

question: Find the value of cos47°sec133° + sin44°cosec136° .
solution:
(c)

Cos 47° Sec 133° + Sin 44° Cosec 136°

= Cos (90° - 43°) Sec (90°+43°) + Sin (90° - 46°) Cosec (90°+ 46°)

= Sin 43° ( - Cosec 43°) + cos 46° sec 46°

- 1 + 1 = 0

question: A, B and C run simultaneously,starting from a point, around a circular track of length 1200 m, at respective speeds of 2m/s, 4m/s and 6m/s. A and B run in the same direction, while C runs in the opposite direction to the other two. After how much time will they meet for the first time?
solution:
(a)

Speed of A, B and C = 2, 4 and 6 m/s respectively

Time when A and B meet = 12004-2 = 600 sec.

Time when A and C meet = 12002+6 = 150 sec.

Time when B and C meet = 12004+6 = 120 sec.

Time when all of them meet for the first time =

L.C.M.(600, 150, 120) = 600 sec = 10 minutes

question: A sum of money invested at a certain rate of simple interest per annum amounts to ₹14,522 in seven years and to ₹18,906 in eleven years. Find the sum invested (in ₹).
solution:
(a)

Simple Interest = P × R × T100

According to question,

(18906 - 14522 ) = (P × R × 11100)-(P × R × 7100)

4384 = (P × R × 4100) ⇒ PR = 109600

Now, (14522 - P) = (109600 × 7100)

Principal = 6850 Rs.

question: If the side of an equilateral triangle is increased by 34%, then by what percentage will its area increase?
solution:
(b)

Area of equilateral triangle = 34a2

According to question ,

Net % increase in area = 34 + 34 + 34 × 34100 = 79.56 %

question: Find the sum of 3 + 3² + 3³ + …………. + 38.
solution:
(c) 3 + 3² + 3³ + …………. + 38

⇒ 3 + 9 + 27+.......+6561

Common ratio (r) = Second termFirst term = 93 = 3

Sn = a(rn-1)(r-1) ⇒ Sn = 3(38-1)(3-1) = 9840

question: A, B and C can do a piece of work in 30 days, 40 days and 50 days, respectively. Beginning with A, if A, B and C do the work alternatively then in how many days will the work be finished?
solution:
(a)

According to question,

Work done in 1 cycle (3 days) = (20 + 15 + 12) = 47 units

Work done in 12 cycle (36 days) = 47 × 12 = 564 units

Remaining work = 600 - 564 = 36 units

Remaining work after 37th and 38th day = 36 - (20 + 15) = 1 unit

Time required to complete remaining work = 112 days

Therefore, Required time = 36 + 2 + 112 = 38112 days


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/images/mceu_46783952011694245985145.png

question: A thief is spotted by a constable from 200 m. When the constable starts the chase, the thief also starts running. If the speed of the constable is 8 km/h and thief runs at the speed of 6 km/h, then how far (in m) will the thief be able to run before he is overtaken ?
solution:
(a)

According to question,

Relative Speed = (8 - 6) = 2 km/h

Required time = 200 ×182 ×5 = 360 sec.

Distance travelled by thief in 360 sec. = 360 × 6 × 518= 600 m

question: In a bag containing red, green and blue pens, the ratio of red, blue and green pens, in the given order, was 7 : 4 : 9. If the total number of pens in the bag was 320, how many of them were red?
solution:
(a)

Let the number of red, blue and green pens be 7x, 4x and 9x.

According to question,

7x + 4x + 9x = 320

x = 16

Required number of red pens (7x) = 7 × 16 = 112

question: Ravi can do a piece of work in 40 days and Sudha can do the same piece of work in 60 days. If they work on alternative days starting with Sudha on the first day, then in how many days will the work be completed?
solution:
(c)

According to question,

Work done in 1 cycle (2 days) = 2 + 3 = 5 unit

Work done in 24 cycle (48 days) = 5 × 24 = 120 units

So, required number of days = 48 days

question: An arc of length 23.1 cm subtends an 18° angle at the centre. What is the area of the circle? [Use π = 227 ]
solution:
(a)

Angle Subtended by arc (in radian)= Length of arcRadius

According to question,

π10 = 23.1Radius ⇒ radius = 231 ×722 = 73.5 cm

Required area of Circle = πr² = 227 × 73.5 × 73.5 = 16978.5 cm²

question:
Study the given table and answer the question that follows.

The table shows the number of candidates who appeared (App), qualified (Qual) and selected (Sel) in a competitive examination from four states Delhi, Goa, Karnataka, and Maharashtra over the years 2012 to 2016.

The number of candidates selected from Maharashtra during the period under review is approximately what percentage of the number selected from Delhi during this period?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694239628/word/media/image63.png
solution:
(d)

According to question,

Total number of candidate selected in Maharashtra = 85 + 70 + 84 + 60 + 65 = 364

Total number of candidate selected in Delhi = 94 + 48 + 90 + 70 + 82 = 384

Required % = 364384 × 100 = 94.79 %

question: 6 If tanπ 6 + secπ 6 = x, then find x.
solution:
(a)

According to question,

tanπ6 + sec π6= x

tan30° + sec30° = x

13 + 23 ⇒ x = 3

question: What is the Total surface area of a cone of base radius 6 cm and height 8 cm?
solution:
(c)

Surface area of cone = πr(r + h2 + r2)

According to question,

Surface area of cone = 227× 6 × (6 + 82 + 62)

227× 6 ×16 = 301.71 cm²

question: 15 men can complete a work in 25 days, and 25 women can complete the same work in 40 days. If all the 15 men and 25 women work together, in how many days will the work get completed?
solution:
(a)

According to question,

15M × 25 = 25W × 40 ⇒ MW = 83

Then, total work = 15 × 8 × 25 = 3000 units

Required time = 3000(15 × 8) + (25 × 3) = 15513 days

question: Suhani pays tax at the rate of 30% on her entire income of ₹90,000 and Ritika pays tax at the rate of 40% on her entire income of ₹y. If the overall tax rate on their combined income comes to 37%, then what is the value of y?
solution:
(d)

Tax paid by Suhani = 90000 × 30100 = 27000 Rs.

According to question,

27000 + 2y5 = 37100 × (90000 + y)

135000 + 2y = (166500 + 37y20)

3y20= 31500 ⇒y = 210000 Rs.

question: working 5 hours a day, A can complete a task in 8 days and working 6 hours a day, B can finish the same task in 10 days, working 8 hours a day, they can jointly complete the task in _____.
solution:
(b)

According to question,

Required time working 8 hrs. per day =1203+2 ×18 = 3 days

question: Simplify, x4 - 2x2 + 1x2 - 2x +1 .
solution:
(c)

x4-2x2+1 x2-2x+1=( x2-12)(x2-12)(x-1)(x-1) = (x+1)(x-1)(x+1)(x-1)(x-1)(x-1)

= (x + 1)(x+1) = x²+ 2x + 1

question: If (x - 1x) = 6 , and x > 1, what is the value of ( x8 - 1x8 )?
solution:
(b)

x- 1x = 6 ⇒ (x-1x)²= 6

⇒ x² + 1x2 = (6)² + 2 = 8

Similarly , x4 + 1x4 = 62 and

x + 1x = (6)2 + 4 = 10

now

x8- 1x8 = [(x4) + 1(x4)] [(x²+ 1 x2) [(x²-1 x2)]

⇒ 62 × 8 × ( x + 1x )( x - 1x )

⇒ 496 × 10 × 6

⇒ 496 × 60 = 496 × 215 = 99215

So, x8 - 1x8 = 99215

question: The successive discounts of 12%, 20% and 25% is equivalent to a single discount of:
solution:
(c)

According to question,

Net Discount of 12 and 20 % = 12 + 20 - 12 × 20100= 29.6 %

Required net discount % = 29.6 + 25 - 29.6 × 25100= 47.2 %

question: If Sinθ = 45 , find the value of tanθ - Cotθ.
solution:
(c)

sinθ = PerpendicularHypotenuse = 45

By using pythagoras theorem,

Base = 25-16 = 3

Therefore, tanθ - cotθ = 43 - 34 = 712

question: Ram sells a suitcase to Mohan at a 20% profit. Mohan sells it to Shyam at a 40% profit. If Shyam pays ₹1,430 for it, then the price at which Ram bought it is :
solution:
(d)

According to question,

Cost price for Ram (x) = x × 120100 × 140100 = 1430 Rs.

x = 1430 ×10012×14 = 851.19 Rs.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

Any female animal which feeds its young on milk from her own body
solution:
(c) Mammal- any female animal which feeds its young on milk from her own body.

Vertebrate- an animal that has a backbone and a skeleton.

Parasite- an organism that lives on or in a host organism and gets its food from or at the expense of its host.

Fauna- animal life in a specific region or period.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

Certain to happen
solution:
(d) Inevitable - certain to happen.

Justifiable - able to be explained or defended with good reason.

Indispensable - absolutely necessary or essential.

Convertible - capable of being converted or transformed into something else.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(a) Nefew

‘Nephew’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Indolent
solution:
(c) Active- doing things that require physical movement and energy.

Indolent- not willing to work; lazy.

Lazy- unwilling to work or expend effort.

Unskilled- lacking the necessary abilities or training for a particular task.

Sluggish- moving or working slowly.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

The Indian independence movement sought to establish the conceptions of freedom and social welfare as the goals of an independent Indian state, resulting in Fundamental Rights and Directive Principles.
solution:
(b) concepts of liberty

The phrase "concept of liberty" means the idea of freedom which includes making your own choices and living your life the way you want. The given sentence states that the Indian Independence movement attempted to establish the concept of liberty and social welfare. Hence, ‘concepts of liberty’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

She might have completed her research by that time.
option_1: Her research might be completed by her by that time.
option_2: Her research might had been completed by her by that time.
option_3: Her research might have been completed by her by that time.
option_4: Her research might have completed by her by that time.
solution:
(c) Her research might have been completed by her by that time. (Correct)

(a) Her research might be completed by her by that time. (Incorrect Helping Verb)

(b) Her research might had been completed by her by that time. (Incorrect Helping Verb)

(d) Her research might have completed by her by that time. (Incorrect Helping Verb)

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

The police were on high alert on account of the _______ convict who had killed many people.
solution:
(d) Runaway

“Runaway" means one who has escaped from custody. The given sentence states that the police were on high alert because of an escaped convict who had killed many people. Hence, ‘runaway’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

He regards himself as a patriot.
solution:
(c) Traitor- one who betrays their country, cause, or allegiance.

Patriot- one who loves, supports, and defends their country.

Nationalist- one who has a strong sense of pride, loyalty and attachment to their nation.

Dutiful- happy to respect and obey somebody.

Loyal- faithful and committed to a person, group, or cause.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

Lucy presented a lucid account of her achievements before the committee
solution:
(b) Ambiguous - having multiple possible meanings or interpretations.

Lucid - clear and easily understandable.

Orderly - arranged or organised in a proper manner.

Intelligible - able to be understood.

Transparent - easily understood or seen through.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Scrape the barrel
option_3: Using all the ways to achieve the desired result
option_4: To be forced to use one's last and weakest resource
solution:
(d) Scrape the barrel - To be forced to use one's last and weakest resource

E.g.- After months of searching, they had to scrape the barrel to find any remaining job candidates.

question:
Select the sentence that uses the given idiom correctly.

A dime a dozen
option_1: Her ideas were worth a dime a dozen and didn't impress the boss.
option_2: The concert tickets were a dime a dozen and sold out quickly.
option_3: The restaurant had some delicious desserts that were a dime a dozen.
option_4: The antique store had some rare finds, but they were a dime a dozen.
solution:
(a) Her ideas were worth a dime a dozen and didn't impress the boss.

The idiom "a dime a dozen" means that something is very common and of no particular value. Going through the options, the sentence given in option ‘a’ has the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

question: Identify the sentence that correctly uses the indefinite article.
option_1: She is a Indian artist married to an European engineer.
option_2: She is an Indian artist married to an European engineer.
option_3: She is an Indian artist married to a European engineer.
option_4: She is a Indian artist married to a European engineer.
solution:
(c) She is an Indian artist married to a European engineer.

Article ‘A’ is used before the words starting from a consonant sound (a European, a story). Whereas, the article ‘An’ is used before the words starting from a vowel sound(an indian artist, an apple). Going through the options, the sentence given in option ‘c’ has the most appropriate use of the indefinite article.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(c) Wilfull

‘Wilful’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words underlined in the sentence.

Only the artists who make sculptures are allowed to take part in exhibitions.
solution:
(c) Sculptor - the artists who make sculptures.

Painter- a person who paints pictures or creates art using paint as a medium.

Artisan- a person who makes things skilfully, especially with his hands.

Potter- a person who makes pot or dishes by shaping and firing clay.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

Payments can be made by ______ or in cash.
solution:
(c) cheque

‘Cheque’ means a piece of paper issued by a bank to pay a specific sum of money to a person or entity. The given sentence states that payments can be made by cheque or in cash. Hence, ‘cheque’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word in the following sentence.

Traitor

People should vote for honest and loyal leaders not for betrayer and defender.
solution:
(d) Loyal - someone who is faithful and committed.

Traitor - someone who betrays or is disloyal.

Honest - someone who is truthful and sincere.

Defender - someone who protects or supports.

Betrayer - someone who betrays or deceives.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.

She always / invite me/to/dinner.
solution:
(d) invite me

According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. At the end of a singular verb, s/es is used. In the given sentence, ‘She’ is a singular subject that will take ‘invites’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘invites me’ is the most appropriate structure.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

By whom was the coffee made?
solution:
(a) Who made the coffee? (Correct)

(b) Who had made the coffee? (Incorrect Tense)

(c) Who has made the coffee? (Incorrect Tense)

(d) Who makes the coffee? (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined words in the given sentence.

Developed countries are at a disadvantage to have access to modern science and technologies.
solution:
(b) Privileged-having an advantage or opportunity that most people do not have.

Powered- supplied with energy or ability to operate.

Useless- having no practical value or purpose.

Unhappy- not feeling content or joyful.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. According to Homer, Achilles was brought up by his mother at Phthia with his inseparable companion Patroclus.

B. Achilles was the bravest, handsomest and greatest warrior of the army of Agamemnon in the Trojan War.

C. Later non-Homeric tales suggest that Patroclus was Achilles' kinsman or lover.

D. Achilles, in Greek mythology, is the son of the mortal Peleus, king of the Myrmidons, and the Nereid Thetis.
solution:
(b) DBAC

Sentence D will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Achilles and his parentage. And, Sentence B talks about his heroic traits. So, B will follow D. Further, Sentence A states that he, along with Patroclus, was brought up by his mother. And Sentence C states his relationship with Patroclus. So, C will follow A. Going through the options, option (b) has the correct sequence.

question:
Cloze Test :

Ambition is a vital ingredient for success. Without ambition to push us, we will not be(96)_______ of great achievements. We all need that special something (97)_____ ourselves to give us the willpower to reach a higher goal (98)_______we imagine ourselves capable______ . Yet, ambition, (100)_____money and fire, is a good servant, but a bad master.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(b) Capable

‘Capable’ means having the ability or potential to achieve something. The given passage states that we will not be capable of great achievements without ambition to push us. Hence, ‘capable’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Ambition is a vital ingredient for success. Without ambition to push us, we will not be(96)_______ of great achievements. We all need that special something (97)_____ ourselves to give us the willpower to reach a higher goal (98)_______we imagine ourselves capable______ . Yet, ambition, (100)_____money and fire, is a good servant, but a bad master.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(d) Within

‘Within’ means inside or inside the limits of something. The given passage states that we all need that special quality within ourselves to give us the willpower to reach a higher goal. Hence, ‘within’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Ambition is a vital ingredient for success. Without ambition to push us, we will not be(96)_______ of great achievements. We all need that special something (97)_____ ourselves to give us the willpower to reach a higher goal (98)_______we imagine ourselves capable______ . Yet, ambition, (100)_____money and fire, is a good servant, but a bad master.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98.
solution:
(b) Than

‘Than’ is used to make comparisons between two or more things. Similarly, in the given sentence, there is a comparison between the goals that we imagine achieving and the goals that we can achieve with willpower. Hence, ‘than’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Ambition is a vital ingredient for success. Without ambition to push us, we will not be(96)_______ of great achievements. We all need that special something (97)_____ ourselves to give us the willpower to reach a higher goal (98)_______we imagine ourselves capable______ . Yet, ambition, (100)_____money and fire, is a good servant, but a bad master.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(c) Of

The word ‘capable’ always takes the preposition ‘of’. Hence, ‘of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :

Ambition is a vital ingredient for success. Without ambition to push us, we will not be(96)_______ of great achievements. We all need that special something (97)_____ ourselves to give us the willpower to reach a higher goal (98)_______we imagine ourselves capable______ . Yet, ambition, (100)_____money and fire, is a good servant, but a bad master.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(b) Like

‘Like’ is used to state similarities between two or more things. The given passage states the similarity between ambition and, money and fire. Hence, ‘like’ is the most appropriate answer.
